column5: Does anyone have any recommended sites for wind forecasts?  I have see forecasts for under 5km and over 20km for tomorrow morning.  That is a pretty big difference for a wind out of east on Lake Ontario.

I find this one is right about 95% of the time - and when its wrong - so are all the others.   Just be sure to select the super-forecast view, as it is often quite different from the forecast. https://www.windfinder.com/weatherforecast/grimsby_ontario Currently set for the Grimsby Buoy, but you can do a search based on the lake / area you are fishing
I use Windfinder and they seem to be the most accurate I have found
I use sailflow...The map is good for visualizing the change in wind direction.
I use them all but like windguru the best .
I have been using, www.wunderground.com. It,s been pretty good to me. Today it was bang on.
If I need to I'll look at a few of them and take an average. But for a quick fix I like windfinders phone app. Never knew about the windfinder "superforecast" however as spincast mentions above.
Thanks, for the info.  I guess I should have got up early on Sunday.
weather underground is pretty accurate for me.
Thanks, for the info.  I guess I should have got up early on Sunday.  Im always up early and on the water just at light John. Get my fix in while I can.
